meanings.definition: To remove the classification from (information, a document, etc.)
meanings.sent1: The government decided to declassify the old files for everyone to see.
meanings.sent2: It is important to declassify sensitive information to promote transparency.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally declassified my own secret recipe for chocolate chip cookies!
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to declassify the tension in the room, making everyone relax.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was so amazing that it seemed to declassify the laws of physics.

meanings.definition: To make (information, a document, etc.) no longer classified.
meanings.sent1: The decision to declassify the report was met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent2: Once they declassify the document, we can finally share it with the public.
meanings.sent3: The spy accidentally declassified the top-secret mission by leaving the file on the bus!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had the power to declassify any serious conversation into a fun one.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting seemed to declassify the boundaries between reality and imagination.
